description: a(n) is the smallest number for which exactly n primes are bounded between a(n) and 2a(n) exclusively.
comments: a(n) is the first occurrence of n in A060715.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
example: a(10)=40 since ten primes,namely,41,43,47,53,59,61,67,71,73,79,first arise between 40 and its double.
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List (elemIndex)import Data.Maybe (mapMaybe)a060756 n = a060756_list !! na060756_list = map (+ 1) $ mapMaybe (`elemIndex` a060715_list) [0..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 05 2012
author: _Lekraj Beedassy_, Apr 23 2001
extensions: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Jun 05 2001
